SEARCH
Package org.cloudbus.cloudsim.plus.vm

Class VMex

java.lang.Object
org.cloudbus.cloudsim.Vm
org.cloudbus.cloudsim.plus.vm.VMex
Direct Known Subclasses:
MonitoredVMex
public class VMex extends Vm
An extension of the base cloudsim VM, adding information about: creation/submission, starting/booting and termination times; the VM status and metadata.
Author:
nikolay.grozev

    • getStatus

      public VMStatus getStatus()
      Returns the status of the VM.
      Returns:
      the status of the VM.

    • setStatus

      public void setStatus(VMStatus status)
      Sets the status of the VM, if possible. For example, if the VM is in terminated state, and the init state is attempted to be set it will not be possible to set the state. In case the state can not be set and IllegalStateException is thrown. The logic about which state transitions are possible is implemented in VMStatus.
      Parameters:
      status - - the new status to set. Must not be null.

    • getSubmissionTime

      public double getSubmissionTime()
      Sets the submission time (time of creation before booting) of the VM.
      Returns:
      the submission time.

    • getStartTime

      public double getStartTime()
      Returns the starting time (after it has booted) of this VM.
      Returns:
      - the starting time (after it has booted) of this VM.

    • getEndTime

      public double getEndTime()
      Returns the ending time (due to failure or termination) of this VM. If the VM is still running then -1 is returned.
      Returns:
      the ending time (due to failure or termination) of this VM.

    • getTimeAfterBooting

      public double getTimeAfterBooting()
      Returns the duration for which this VM has been functional (after booting).
      Returns:
      the duration for which this VM has been functional (after booting).

    • getTimeAfterSubmission

      public double getTimeAfterSubmission()
      Returns the duration for which this VM has existed (after its creation).
      Returns:

    • getLifeDuration

      public double getLifeDuration()
      If the VM is finished returns its lifetime period. Otherwise - 0;
      Returns:
      if the VM is finished returns its lifetime period. Otherwise - 0;

    • getCurrentTime

      protected double getCurrentTime()
      Returns the current simulation time. Can be overridden for test purposes, as CloudSim.clock() can not be mocked.
      Returns:
      the current simulation time.

    • clone

      public VMex clone(CloudletScheduler scheduler)
      Makes a deep copy of this VM. The only properties which are not copied are the id, the scheduler, the status, and the submission/start/end times. The id of the resulting VM is uniquely generated and the scheduler is provided as a parameter.
      Parameters:
      scheduler - - must not be null. Must be a valid scheduler.
      Returns:
      a deep copy of this VM.
